Test Description: Testing basic game understanding and rule understanding.
Question: How many unique ways can the tile B be placed in the current landscape?
Rationale: According to the placement rules: We have to place a tile such that it continues the landscape. Option B has road on three sides and grass on one side. In the given landscape, considering the number of sides (or boundaries) having only one grass (without adjacency constraints): 6 sides, therefore tile B can be placed in 6 different ways (grass to grass matching). Now considering the road side, there is only one side in the landscape that has a road connection open to the border, therefore tile B can be placed in 3 different ways (road to road matching). Therefore, the total number of ways tile B can be placed in the current landscape is 6 + 3 = 9 ways.
